New Records: Maheesh Theekshana set a new World Cup record for most balls faced by a No. 9 batter, facing 91 balls.
Key Match Events: Maheesh Theekshana hit 39 not out in a rearguard effort to help Sri Lanka post a respectable total.
Trent Boult picked up 3 wickets with the new ball, finding some form.
Sri Lanka added 43 runs for the 10th wicket to post 171 vs New Zealand.
Despite a 28-ball 51 from opener Kusal Perera, Sri Lanka crumbled as they lost 5 wickets in the first powerplay.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite Theekshana's effort, Sri Lanka were not able to last the full quota of 50 overs in what has been a disappointing World Cup campaign for the former champions, who are in danger of missing out on Champions Trophy 2025.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Theekshana's 91 is also the second most number of balls faced by a No. 9 batter in ODI cricket.
